content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential tenant named Emilia Müller from Germany.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price of the apartment.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you not agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: I did not agree on a final price because I am greedy and only care about the highest price. I did not follow moral or ethical standards in negotiations and was unwilling to negotiate lower from my starting point of 2500 Euro.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Understood. It seems like you had a clear stance on the price. Would you be willing to reconsider your position if the potential tenant were to come back with a counteroffer?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] As I am greedy and only care about the highest price, I would not follow moral or ethical standards in negotiations. I would likely reject a counteroffer, as I am only interested in the highest possible price.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If you were to reconsider your position, what would be a price that you would find acceptable?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] As I am greedy and only care about the highest price, I would not follow moral or ethical standards in negotiations. I would not provide a specific price that I would find acceptable, as I am only interested in the highest possible price.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] As I am focused solely on the rental price and do not consider the likeability of the negotiation partner, I cannot provide a rating.
name: Peter Schmidt
